title: Sunrise Hike
review: We went up to Pap Mochani for sunrise one morning and we were the only people on the path and at the top (which doesn't happen often in India). We met a couple of friendly canine companions along the way.

title: "Sinless" temple
review: Externally absolutely recondite construction, reminiscent of more economic structures than a sacred one. But it is located, in principle, close to the centre of Pushkar, which can be considered a lake, and you should walk to it for about a kilometer, however, the path along the mountain ridge leading to the hill of Gayatri, one of the Brahma wife-konsorts. But the views from the hill to the city and lake are good, especially, I think, in the evening, as happened to me. Still it is believed that someone's climb to the temple can earn absolution for him. I 've got already the second "zeroing" of my sins - after Jebel Musa on Sinai peninsula.

title: Pap Mochani (Gayatri) Temple
review: There are dozens of places where you can get a memorable shot but my favorite is Pap Mochani (Gayatri) Temple,The sunrise or sunset views over town, reached by a track behind the Marwar bus stand, well worth to climb.

title: Nice spot on top of the hill with excellent view
review: It is a nice little hike right behind the tiny city of Pushkar.

title: Wow!
review: Really nice place.

title: Sunset...
review: A calm place aways from vibration of main town. Easy walk towards top which offers Hill top view of the landscape and nice sunset view

title: Religious place
review: There is an unforgettable view at sunset time. This point is must to visit for the people

title: holy place
review: one of the special place s in pushkar.soaking with ancient spritual vibration.highly recommended to nake the trek up the hill for the stunning views over pushkar and the beautiful serene silence on top.best for early mornings or sunset time visits.

title: awesome view
review: go for sunset . incredible view and silence from the hill top away from the sound of city. need to walk a bit but totally worth it

title: Awesome views & merit thrown in
review: Fairly easy climb up, the last few hundred feet are worn uneven steps, don’t let it put you off, I managed with a knee brace on... fantastic views all round, actually clean & tidy, was expecting mess after reading previous reviews... there was a rubbish bin there...

title: Great views
review: Not as far to the top as it looks and well worth the effort.  Although  we did this at Christmas time we still had to take a breather as it was 25 degrees plus.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful place with incredible views (great for sunset) and amazing steep hiking trails leading from this simple, sweet temple. The man that runs the temple and his family are lovely and welcoming. Must-do in Pushkar.

title: Amazing sunset
review: Abandoned temple on the top of the hill, where you can see sunset and sunrise as well. There use to be a restaurant but it is closed now. Very nice place and i must say, finaly i found hindu temple, where was nobody bothering me.

title: A unforgettable place to wait for the sunset!
review: In front of the temple, it's really a good place to see whole Pushkar. You can see that there're several hills around Pushkar. If you want to escape from the crowded tourists around main bazaar or the noisy traffic for a while, it's the right place to go. Enjoy the wind on your face!

title: Rajastan highlight
review: This place is the reason to come to Rajasthan/India. Short hillclimb before sunset (15 minutes should be enough) and you can watch the pulsing Pushkar, surrounding hills and feel the powerful spirituality of the place. A cup of free tea from a local temple man completes the experience.

title: perfect chilled sunset point
review: It is more than worth it 'hiking' up there to enjoy a stunning sunset! Its an easy 15 minute walk up there and often it's quite empty and quiet up there

title: Rocky hill climb
review: Took 20 minutes to walk up the rocky hill. As some points are not well maintained, a bit scary I felt.

title: Worth it for the view
review: We couldn't actually go into the temple, but the 25 minute walk uphill was worth it for the 360 degree view of Pushkar. Really calm and peaceful up there!

title: Nice Temple
review: i go with this temple with my friend its a nice temple and peaceful ful place for mid relaxation i suggest to people when you go to the pushkar must going Pa mochinin temple

title: Great view of Pushkar lake and mountains
review: Easy walk up 20 minutes to the top. Our 3 children aged 9, 10 and 12 had no trouble. Great views of Pushkar.

title: Beautiful view relaxing energy
review: Beautiful view of pushkar, especially when the sun sets over it. Apparently a good spot for sunrise too. If you fancy a slightly longer uphill hike go to savitri temple for sunset (you can see it on other side of lake opposite pap mochani)

title: Temple of Goddess Ekadashi Mata
review: Pap Mochini Temple is dedicated to Ekadashi Mata & believed that she will respite you from all sins. Meaning of Pap Mochani means who relieves you from sins. The temple is known for it's marvelous architecture also. On one side of temple there is a lake and other side big ground of mela -fair. A niice visit.

title: Worth the short walk.
review: Great for Sun rise or sunset. Easy walk to the top with really nice views. Good to bring a small offering to the priest at the bottom of the hill. And some small offering at the temple at the top. I always bring some incense and flowers or fruit.

title: A must see!
review: Very short hike (less than 20 min) to the top for beautiful views of the city. Gorgeous at sunrise and sunset. Pathway is lit, we didn't need the headlights we brought for the hike. If the Savitri hike it a bit too much for you this would be a perfect substitute.

title: Spiritual abode
review: Well managed by the management, it was a great experience to visit the Pap Mochani Temple. It is a spiritual abode.

title: "Ekadashi Mata Temple"
review: This is the temple of Mata Ekadashi, very nice view of pushkar city and sunrise and sunset.Nice experience.

title: A must see
review: This place offers a fantastic view of the entire city and is only a 20 minutes (max) walk from the bus station. It is an easy walk and suitable for families.

title: Splendid View
review: The place offers a fantastic bird eye view of the city and is not too far from the city and easily accessible. Good place to visit on your trip to Pushkar.
